meanings.definition: To form a mental image or idea of something
meanings.sent1: I can conceive a plan to build a sandcastle.
meanings.sent2: She likes to conceive stories in her mind before bedtime.
meanings.sent3: Trying to conceive a rainbow-colored elephant is quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her mind could conceive the most beautiful landscapes.
meanings.sent5: He could conceive the perfect birthday surprise for his friend.

meanings.definition: To become pregnant with a child
meanings.sent1: The couple hoped to conceive a baby soon.
meanings.sent2: After a few months, they were able to conceive a child.
meanings.sent3: The idea of their cat trying to conceive a kitten was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The fertile soil seemed to conceive new life every spring.
meanings.sent5: She was overjoyed when she finally conceived a baby girl.

meanings.definition: To understand or grasp a concept
meanings.sent1: It took me a while to conceive the math problem.
meanings.sent2: With practice, she was able to conceive the complex theory.
meanings.sent3: Trying to conceive the idea of a talking dog made her laugh.
meanings.sent4: His mind could conceive the depths of philosophical questions.
meanings.sent5: She struggled to conceive the concept of time travel.
